claims.claim: Prison gerrymandering diverts educational resources away from Detroit public schools.
claims.quote: it's like when you lock up our residents from Detroit, [...] the money and resources go to those schools. [...] And it takes away from Detroit Public schools.

claims.claim: Inequities in school funding contribute to the school-to-prison pipeline.
claims.quote: the schools are shitty, they don't get as many resources as all the other schools. [...] it's like you setting them up for the prison and school pipeline.

claims.claim: Teachers in Detroit public schools are underpaid compared to suburban schools, affecting student attention and quality of education.
claims.quote: You don't pay the teachers as much as they need to be paid. [...] they can't give our students as much of attention as they might need to excel.

claims.claim: Classroom overcrowding in Detroit schools limits individual student attention and learning opportunities.
claims.quote: Cram their classrooms where they can't give our students as much of attention as they might need to excel.

claims.claim: Every child in Michigan deserves access to high-quality education, regardless of their location.
claims.quote: I feel like my child should get a top A grade education no matter where I live, whether it's Flint, whether it's Jackson, [...] or Detroit.

claims.claim: Budget constraints in Detroit schools limit the diversity of teaching methods and learning support.
claims.quote: because of the budget restraints, the teachers aren't allowed enough liberty to be to explore different ways of reaching their students.

claims.claim: Students with unique learning needs are not adequately supported in Detroit public schools.
claims.quote: I'm dyslexic and I learn differently, [...] and I feel like because of the budget restraints, the teachers [...] don't have enough capacity to do that because they're overcrowded.
